'''Vanillish''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''バニリッチ''' ''Vanirich'') is an {{type|Ice}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Vanillite}} starting at [[level]] 35 and evolves into {{p|Vanilluxe}} starting at level 47.

==Biology==
[[File:Snowless Vanillish.png|thumb|left|170px|A "bald" Vanillish with a melted snow covering]]
Vanillish have large, white, rounded upper bodies with a swirled substance on top, making it resemble a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Its eyes are dark blue with small, ice crystals at the sides. Vanillish has a dark blue mouth, two ice crystals below its mouth, and stubby, limbs that resemble icicles. It has a pointed lower body that resembles a large icicle. 

Vanillish lives in southern, snowy mountains, which it migrated to during an ancient ice age. It creates ice inside its body by drinking water, and expels it to hide itself or freeze opponents. It can shatter frozen opponents with powerful headbutts. Vanillish are smaller in hotter regions, and though it can refreeze its snow despite melting, this process can leave its appearance warped.
{{left clear}}

==In the anime==
[[File:Vanillish anime.png|thumb|left|250px|Vanillish in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Vanillish debuted in ''[[BW057|The Mighty Accelguard to the Rescue!]]'', under the ownership of [[Dr. Ferrara|Dr. Ferrara/Cryogonal Man]].

A Vanillish appeared in ''[[BW079|Caution: Icy Battle Conditions!]]'', under the ownership of [[Brycen]]. Brycen used Vanillish in a Gym battle against {{Ash}}, where it battled against {{AP|Krookodile}} before being defeated by {{AP|Scraggy}}.

A Vanillish appeared in ''[[XY057|Thawing an Icy Panic!]]'' alongside a {{p|Vanilluxe}}, where they were looking for a {{p|Vanillite}} who had gone missing and created a big snowstorm in [[Coumarine City]].

===Minor appearances===
A Vanillish appeared in ''[[XY080|Performing with Fiery Charm!]]'', under the ownership of a [[Pokémon Performer]]. It reappeared in ''[[XY112|Master Class is in Session!]]'', where it was used in the Master Class Pokémon Showcase in [[Gloire City]]; and then again in ''[[XY113|Performing a Pathway to the Future!]]'', where it was seen watching the same Master Class Pokémon Showcase.

==In the manga==
[[File:Brycen Vanillish Adventures.png|thumb|130px|Vanillish in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Vanillish owned by a girl in Catelia City appeared in ''[[PS479|The Case of the Missing Pokémon]]'', where they watch as [[Bo|Tep]] trying to find the person who kidnapped {{adv|Bianca}}'s {{p|Litwick}}.

[[Brycen]] owns three Vanillish. They were first used to train {{adv|Black}}'s Pokémon while a single one was used to later battle Black in a Gym battle in ''[[PS499|School of Hard Knocks]]''.

==Trivia==
* According to Game Freak, Vanillish and its {{p|Vanillite|evolutionary}} {{p|Vanilluxe|relatives}} were created by [[James Turner]].<ref>http://web.archive.org/web/20130115083652/http://www.gamefreak.co.jp/blog/staff/?p=204</ref>
* Vanillish and {{p|Braviary}} weigh as much as {{ga|Lyra}}.

===Origin===
Vanillish is based on an {{wp|ice cream cone}} made of snow and ice. It also resembles an {{wp|icicle}}.

====Name origin====
Vanillish is a combination of ''{{wp|vanilla}}'' and ''delish'' (slang term for delicious).

Vanirich may be a combination of ''vanilla'' and ''rich'' (abounding with).
